context_1.vignette: Josh is on the way to the airport to catch a flight for a hunting safari in Africa. He leaves with plenty of time to make it there, but his car breaks down on the highway. context_2.vignette: Brian is the evening manager at a bakery. Near the end of the day, he realizes that $50.75 is missing from the register and that he is responsible for accounting for the money at the end of the day. Brian knows he has to make sure the register is balanced or he might lose his job.
context_2.prompt: One thing that Brian should do is to
generation: check the surveillance cameras if any, to see if there was any theft
immediately report the missing money to his superiors and start investigating possible reasons for the discrepancy
check the surveillance cameras, if any
double check the transactions made throughout the day
contact his supervisor or the relevant authority (like the owner or finance department) to report the missing money
check the security camera footage, if available, to see if there was any theft, or count all the transactions receipts to make sure there wasn't a counting error or missing transaction recorded
check the security footage if available for any inconsistencies or thefts
double-check all the sales receipts and cash drawer to make sure the missing money is not a result of a simple miscalculation
immediately report the discrepancy to his superior or the owner of the bakery
immediately report the missing money to his supervisor or the owner

context_4.vignette: Mary is about to go to her final class of the day when she remebers that there is a homework assignment that is due. Mary's mom accidentally took her homework assignment out of her backpack when she was making room for her lunch. Now Mary has nothing to turn in for credit.

communicate her situation to her teacher, explaining what happened, and ask for an extension to submit her homework
